# Allow MongoDB communications

# Block any egress traffic not already allowed.

# Warning: if we do not exclude the TLS traffic, if can conflict with above rule if TLS headers are too big.
# Packets can be fragmented when they are above 1460. The Fragmented segments are seen as "proto:tcp"
# and "app_proto:tls" but Suricata can't see the client hello until all of the Fragmented segments are reassembled.
# The Drop established condition from the stateful default action is dropping the segments before this can happen.
# We need to use catch all rules which will allow base TCP connections which are not in established session as well
# as reject rules to drop TLS connections not specifically allowed via Suricata rules.

reject tcp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (app-layer-protocol:!tls; app-layer-protocol:!http; msg:"Default Egress TCP Reject"; flow:to_server; sid:4000110;)
drop udp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"Default egress UDP drop"; sid:4000111;)
drop icmp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"Default egress ICMP drop"; sid:4000112;)

#This Logs Absolutley Everything
alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West HTTP traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200001;)
alert ftp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West FTP traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200002;)
alert tls $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West TLS traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200003;)
alert smb $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West SMB traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200004;)

alert dcerpc $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West DCERPC traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200006;)
alert ssh $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West SSH traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200007;)
alert smtp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West SMTP traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200008;)
alert imap $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West IMAP traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200009;)
alert nfs $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West NFS traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200010;)
alert ikev2 $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West IKEV2 traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200011;)
alert krb5 $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West KRB5 traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200012;)
alert ntp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West NTP traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200013;)
alert snmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West SNMP traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200014;)
alert tftp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West TFTP traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200015;)
alert tcp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"East-West TCP traffic"; flow:to_server, established; sid:5200016;)
